content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Four quarter notes in treble clef. The pitches are C4, E-flat 4, G-flat 4, B-flat 4.
Four quarter notes in treble clef. The pitches are C4, E4, G4, B-flat 4.
Four quarter notes in treble clef. The pitches are C4, E4, G4, B4.
Four quarter notes in treble clef. The pitches are C4, E-flat 4, G4, B-flat 4.

content.answer: Four quarter notes in treble clef. The pitches are C4, E4, G4, B-flat 4.

unit.text: 3: Music Fundamentals III - Triads and Seventh Chords

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
